page.title: 03H.M.S. Warrior in Hartlepool
page.content:
{1. What type of ship was H.M.S. {Warrior?} The H.M.S. Warrior was the first iron warship currently being restored,the only surviving iron warship in the world. {2. Where was she built? }H.M.S. Warrior was built by Thames Ironworks and Shipbuilding Co. It was built on the River Thames in London. She was jointly designed and built by the Admiralty and John Scott Russel. {3. What was it made of?}The H.M.S. Warrior was made of iron and wood on the bottom, and on the top wood. It was teak backed, armour plated and all iron hull. {4. How old is she?} The H.M.S.Warrior is 125 years old. She was made in 1860. { {
{ }
